channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The next possible target in Trump’s battle with Harvard: Hiking the tax on its $53 billion endowment
item.description: A bill in Congress would increase the endowment tax for Harvard and other schools to 21%, the equivalent of the corporate tax rate.

item.title: ‘We are the most privileged’: My husband and I are tired of paying for our friends. How do we get them to pay their way?
item.description: “My husband almost always ends up paying for everyone or picks up the entire bill.”

item.title: A real-estate giant wants sellers to list their homes privately. Will homeowners benefit?
item.description: Selling a home has been tough in a sluggish market, but now some real-estate agents want sellers to keep their for-sale listings private.

item.title: Debt collection on defaulted student loans starts today. Here’s what happens next.
item.description: Borrowers who are roughly a year behind on their loans could face harsh consequences such as having their Social Security benefits taken and their wag...

item.title: My friend’s partner is pregnant, but she’s married to another man. Is he financially responsible?
item.description: “She claimed her husband was cheating on her and stopped paying their mortgage.”

item.title: Bryan Johnson wants to start a new religion in which “the body is God”
item.description: Bryan Johnson is on a mission to not die. The 47-year-old multimillionaire has already applied his slogan “Don’t Die” to events, merchandise, and a Ne...

item.title: The great cognitive migration: How AI is reshaping human purpose, work and meaning
item.description: Humans need to embrace domains where AI still falters, and where human creativity, ethics and emotion emain indispensable.

item.title: HEBI Robotics wins RBR50 award for ‘inchworm’ robot family

item.title: Not everything needs an LLM: A framework for evaluating when AI makes sense
item.description: The answer to 'What customer needs requires an AI solution?' isn’t always 'Yes.' LLMs are still expensive and not always accurate.

item.title: RSAC 2025: Why the AI agent era means more demand for CISOS
item.description: RSAC 2025 made one thing clear: AI agents are entering security workflows, but boards want proof they work.

item.title: Toyota, Waymo consider joint development of self-driving passenger vehicles
item.description: Toyota and its Woven division are exploring a partnership with Waymo to develop autonomous technology for consumer-owned cars. The post Toyota, Waymo ...

item.title: Chang Robotics announces $50M fund, 2025 strategic roadmap
item.description: Chang Robotics, an engineering firm working in manufacturing, collaborative robotics, and automation, is focusing on U.S. expansion. The post Chang Ro...

item.title: OpenAI overrode concerns of expert testers to release sycophantic GPT-4o
item.description: Once again, it shows the importance of incorporating more domains beyond the traditional math and computer science into AI development.

item.title: Roblox breaks ground on data center in Brazil for early 2026
item.description: At Gamescom Latam, Roblox announced it has broken ground on a new data center in Brazil -- slated to go live in early 2026.
